intro: Holostigma tenuifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf holostigma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
